1107400909280169991.text:
Want to send crypto on Telegram?

1: Invite https://telegram.me/SendCryptoBot  to your group
2: Use the pay command to start a transfer:

/pay @Alice $1
/pay @Alice 1 ETH
/pay @Alice $20 ETH

3. Pay via @RequestNetwork 
4. The bot will post a message once the payment is confirmedpic.twitter.com/YyFXeVZjmx

1105536707724627968.text:
Are you ready for 3/14? Celebrate #PiDai for #PiDay by donating some of your #crypto to charity!

Read more below and we'll see you on #PiDay:https://blog.makerdao.com/pidai-for-piday/ …

1122744850019966976.text:
WIP weekend project: GitCoin Experts - on-demand p2p mentorship/support with payment channels. 

- Post a request for help
- Experts offer assistance
- Select an expert and start session
- $ is continuously streamed from payer to payee
- After the session, expert withdraws fundspic.twitter.com/L6yzL4MPlZ

1106891680626675717.text: Defi in a Box - a proof of concept Python/Docker stack for running #DeFi projects locally with Ganache. It deploys some test ERC20s and creates @UniswapExchange exchanges (with liquidity) for each token.https://github.com/mikery/defi-in-a-box …

1112603032703913985.text: Weekend project: xDai Chess with state channels. Each move updates the game's state hash, which is signed by both players. Burner wallets are used to auto-sign state channel updates. Each player deposits xDai - the winner takes it all.pic.twitter.com/fU1b4XHEVg

1112611814158807040.text: Thanks! No, just one tx to start the session (executed by the game host), and one transaction to finish the session (executed by either party). In theory you could play an unlimited number of games with just two transactions.https://twitter.com/elviric/status/1112603956230918145 …
